# High-Level System Architecture Diagram

Based on the masterplan for the "Basic App," I've created a high-level architecture diagram that illustrates the potential system components. Since the specific purpose and features are yet to be defined, this diagram represents a flexible foundation that can be adapted as the project evolves.

The architecture follows a modern client-server model with cross-platform capabilities, as suggested in the technical stack recommendations. It includes frontend clients, a backend API layer, database storage, and essential supporting services.

```svg
<svg width="800" height="600" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <!-- Background -->
  <rect width="800" height="600" fill="#f8f9fa" rx="10" ry="10"/>
  
  <!-- Title -->
  <text x="400" y="40" font-family="Arial" font-size="24" text-anchor="middle" font-weight="bold" fill="#333">Basic App - High-Level Architecture</text>
  
  <!-- Client Layer -->
  <rect x="100" y="100" width="600" height="100" rx="10" ry="10" fill="#61dafb" fill-opacity="0.7" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  <text x="400" y="130" font-family="Arial" font-size="18" text-anchor="middle" font-weight="bold" fill="#333">Client Layer</text>
  
  <!-- Client Components -->
  <rect x="150" y="150" width="120" height="40" rx="5" ry="5" fill="#fff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"/>
  <text x="210" y="175" font-family="Arial" font-size="14" text-anchor="middle" fill="#333">Mobile App</text>
  
  <rect x="340" y="150" width="120" height="40" rx="5" ry="5" fill="#fff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"/>
  <text x="400" y="175" font-family="Arial" font-size="14" text-anchor="middle" fill="#333">Web App</text>
  
  <rect x="530" y="150" width="120" height="40" rx="5" ry="5" fill="#fff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"/>
  <text x="590" y="175" font-family="Arial" font-size="14" text-anchor="middle" fill="#333">Desktop App</text>
  
  <!-- Backend Layer -->
  <rect x="100" y="250" width="600" height="100" rx="10" ry="10" fill="#6db33f" fill-opacity="0.7" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  <text x="400" y="280" font-family="Arial" font-size="18" text-anchor="middle" font-weight="bold" fill="#333">Backend API Layer</text>
  
  <!-- Backend Components -->
  <rect x="150" y="300" width="120" height="40" rx="5" ry="5" fill="#fff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"/>
  <text x="210" y="325" font-family="Arial" font-size="14" text-anchor="middle" fill="#333">RESTful API</text>
  
  <rect x="340" y="300" width="120" height="40" rx="5" ry="5" fill="#fff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"/>
  <text x="400" y="325" font-family="Arial" font-size="14" text-anchor="middle" fill="#333">Auth Service</text>
  
  <rect x="530" y="300" width="120" height="40" rx="5" ry="5" fill="#fff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"/>
  <text x="590" y="325" font-family="Arial" font-size="14" text-anchor="middle" fill="#333">Business Logic</text>
  
  <!-- Data Layer -->
  <rect x="100" y="400" width="600" height="100" rx="10" ry="10" fill="#f0ad4e" fill-opacity="0.7" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  <text x="400" y="430" font-family="Arial" font-size="18" text-anchor="middle" font-weight="bold" fill="#333">Data Layer</text>
  
  <!-- Data Components -->
  <rect x="250" y="450" width="120" height="40" rx="5" ry="5" fill="#fff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"/>
  <text x="310" y="475" font-family="Arial" font-size="14" text-anchor="middle" fill="#333">Database</text>
  
  <rect x="430" y="450" width="120" height="40" rx="5" ry="5" fill="#fff" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"/>

  <line x1="210" y1="190" x2="210" y2="300" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2" stroke-dasharray="5,5">
    <animate attributeName="stroke-dashoffset" from="10" to="0" dur="1s" repeatCount="indefinite" />
  </line>

    <animate attributeName="stroke-dashoffset" from="10" to="0" dur="1s" repeatCount="indefinite" />
  </line>
  
  <!-- Backend to Data -->
  <line x1="210" y1="340" x2="310" y2="450" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2" stroke-dasharray="5,5">
    <animate attributeName="stroke-dashoffset" from="10" to="0" dur="1s" repeatCount="indefinite" />
  </line>
  <line x1="400" y1="340" x2="310" y2="450" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2" stroke-dasharray="5,5">
    <animate attributeName="stroke-dashoffset" from="10" to="0" dur="1s" repeatCount="indefinite" />

  <line x1="590" y1="340" x2="490" y2="450" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2" stroke-dasharray="5,5">

  <!-- Legend -->
  <rect x="600" y="520" width="15" height="15" fill="#61dafb" fill-opacity="0.7" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"/>
  <text x="620" y="533" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">Client Layer</text>
  
  <rect x="600" y="540" width="15" height="15" fill="#6db33f" fill-opacity="0.7" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"/>
  <text x="620" y="553" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">Backend Layer</text>
  
  <rect x="600" y="560" width="15" height="15" fill="#f0ad4e" fill-opacity="0.7" stroke="#333" stroke-width="1"/>
  <text x="620" y="573" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">Data Layer</text>
  
  <line x1="600" y1="580" x2="615" y2="580" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2" stroke-dasharray="5,5"/>
  <text x="620" y="583" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">Data Flow</text>
</svg>
```

## Architecture Explanation

This high-level architecture follows a three-tier model:

1. **Client Layer (Blue)**: Represents the user-facing applications that could be developed using cross-platform frameworks like React Native or Flutter as mentioned in the masterplan. This allows the app to target multiple platforms from a single codebase.

2. **Backend API Layer (Green)**: Houses the server-side components including RESTful APIs, authentication services, and business logic. The masterplan suggests Node.js with Express or Python with Django as potential technologies for this layer.

3. **Data Layer (Orange)**: Manages data persistence through databases and file storage systems. The specific database technology would be selected based on the evolving requirements of the app.

The animated dashed lines represent data flow between the components, illustrating how information moves through the system. This architecture provides a flexible foundation that can accommodate future expansion possibilities as mentioned in the masterplan.

The diagram intentionally keeps implementation details abstract since the masterplan indicates that the app's specific purpose and features are yet to be defined. As the project evolves and more requirements are gathered, this architecture can be refined to include more specific components and technologies.
